alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Bradley; Calhoun; Cleveland; Dallas; Desha; Drew; Jefferson; Lincoln; Monroe; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 05 at 11:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: .Persistent heavy and training rainfall is forecast across much of the watch area through late Thursday afternoon with forecast amounts of two to three inches and locally greater values possible. Observed rainfall over the last seven days cross southern and southeastern Arkansas indicates widespread accumulations of two to three inches, and numerous streams and small river basins running at least above-normal stream flow. Additional heavy rainfall could lead to flooding issues around the watch area over the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Arkansas, southeast Arkansas and southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, in eastern Arkansas, Monroe. In southeast Arkansas, Arkansas, Bradley, Cleveland, Desha, Drew, Jefferson and Lincoln. In southwest Arkansas, Calhoun, Dallas and Ouachita. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Bradley; Calhoun; Cleveland; Dallas; Desha; Drew; Jefferson; Lincoln; Monroe; Ouachita
